c:
It was two in the morning. I was sitting in my hostel room, eyes glued to my laptop screen, watching episode after episode of my favorite show. Suddenly, I heard a knock on my door.

"Who could it be at this hour?" I mumbled to myself as I got up to open the door.

To my surprise, it was Chandan-da, our hostel's caretaker, standing there. He was holding a small bag filled with some snacks.

"Chandan-da?" I asked, rubbing my eyes. "I thought you were going home today for the Diwali break."

Chandan-da gave me an odd smile. "The hostel is closing tomorrow for the holidays. You and one other boy are the only ones left here. I thought I should bring you some food."

I looked at him more carefully. Something about his appearance seemed different. His eyes were cloudy, unfocused. As my gaze traveled down his body, I froze. He was covered in blood. His clothes were torn and bloodstained. His arms and legs had deep gashes, and his skin looked unnaturally pale.

With shaky hands, I took the bag from him and asked, "Are... are you okay, Chandan-da? Why are you all bloody?"

Chandan-da just stared at me blankly for a while. Then he said, "Can you do me a favor? Can you call my family and give them a message?"

"What message?" I asked, feeling confused and scared.

"Please tell them I'm on Highway 34," Chandan-da said in a flat voice. "Ask them to look for me carefully inside the overturned bus. The glass and metal in my body... they are starting to bother me now."

Before I could say anything, Chandan-da turned around and seemed to float toward the main gate. He passed silently through the closed gate. I stood there for a long time, staring at the gate. I looked down at the food packets in my hand. "Should I eat this?" I wondered.
